Package de.gnwi.mfsim.model.peptide.utils.configuration

Class Frame

java.lang.Object
de.gnwi.mfsim.model.peptide.utils.configuration.Frame
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Frame extends Object implements Serializable
Implementation of a Frame/Rigid/Euclidean transformation. All angles are in radians (to translate between radians and degrees use Math.toRadians(), Math.toDegrees() ).
Author:
Ziv Yaniv
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • SMALL_ANGLE

      public static final double SMALL_ANGLE
      Small angle
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Frame

      public Frame()
      Construct the identity transformation.

    • Frame

      public Frame(Frame f)
      Copy Constructor, create a frame which is a copy of the given frame.
      Parameters:
      f - This frame is copied.

    • Frame

      public Frame(double x, double y, double z, double az, double ay, double ax)
      Create a frame with the given translations and rotation angles.
      Parameters:
      x - Translation in the x direction.
      y - Translation in the y direction.
      z - Translation in the z direction.
      az - Angle of rotation around the z axis.
      ay - Angle of rotation around the y axis.
      ax - Angle of rotation around the x axis.

    • Frame

      public Frame(double x, double y, double z, double[] axis, double angle)
      Create a frame with the given translations and rotation around the given axis with the given angle. Axis of rotation is assumed to be normalized.
      Parameters:
      x - Translation in the x direction.
      y - Translation in the y direction.
      z - Translation in the z direction.
      axis - Axis of rotation.
      angle - Angle of rotation around the given axis.

    • Frame

      public Frame(double x, double y, double z, double[] axisAngle)
      Create a frame with the given translations and rotation around the given axis and angle. The norm of the axis is the size of the rotation angle.
      Parameters:
      x - Translation in the x direction.
      y - Translation in the y direction.
      z - Translation in the z direction.
      axisAngle - The direction of this vector is the axis of rotation and its norm is the size of the rotation angle.

    • Frame

      public Frame(double x, double y, double z, double s, double qx, double qy, double qz)
      Create a frame with the given translations and rotation according to the given quaternion. Assumes that the quaternion is a unit quaternion (s^2 + qx^2 + qy^2 + qz^2 = 1).
      Parameters:
      x - Translation in the x direction.
      y - Translation in the y direction.
      z - Translation in the z direction.
      s - Scalar part of the quaternion.
      qx - x coordinate of the quaternion.
      qy - y coordinate of the quaternion.
      qz - z coordinate of the quaternion.

  • Method Details

    • apply

      public void apply(Point3D p)
      Apply the transformation on the given point and update the point coordinates accordingly.
      Parameters:
      p - The point on which the transformation is applied.
      See Also:
      • Point3D

    • apply

      public void apply(Point3D p, Point3D pTransformed)
      Apply the transformation on the given point and set the results in the second point.
      Parameters:
      p - The point on which the transformation is applied.
      pTransformed - The result of applying the transformation on point p.
      See Also:
      • Point3D

    • applyInverse

      public void applyInverse(Point3D p)
      Apply the inverse transformation on the given point and update the point coordinates accordingly. If the inverse transformation is applied many times it is computationally more efficient to invert the frame and then use the inverted frame's apply() method.
      Parameters:
      p - The point on which the transformation is applied.
      See Also:
      • Point3D

    • applyInverse

      public void applyInverse(Point3D p, Point3D pTransformed)
      Apply the inverse transformation on the given point and update the point coordinates accordingly. If the inverse transformation is applied many times it is computationally more efficient to invert the frame and then use the inverted frame's apply() method.
      Parameters:
      p - The point on which the transformation is applied.
      pTransformed - The result of applying the transformation on point p.
      See Also:
      • Point3D

    • mul

      public void mul(Frame f1, Frame f2)
      Compute the composition/multiplication (f1 o f2) of two frames and store the result in this frame.
      Parameters:
      f1 - Left operand of the composition.
      f2 - Right operand of the composition.

    • mul

      public void mul(Frame f)
      Compute the composition/multiplication (this o f) of two frames and store the result in this frame.
      Parameters:
      f - Right operand of the composition.

    • invert

      public void invert()
      Invert the frame.

    • invert

      public void invert(Frame f)
      Invert the given frame and store the result in this frame.
      Parameters:
      f - The frame whose inverse we set this frame to be.

    • setIdentity

      public void setIdentity()
      Set this frame to the identity transformation, no rotation and no translation.

    • setTranslation

      public void setTranslation(double x, double y, double z)
      Set this frame's translation to the given translation.
      Parameters:
      x - Translation in the x direction.
      y - Translation in the y direction.
      z - Translation in the z direction.

    • setTranslation

      public void setTranslation(double[] translation)
      Set this frame's translation to the given translation. Assumes that the given array has at least three entries.
      Parameters:
      translation - Array containing the translation parameters [x,y,z].

    • setRotation

      public void setRotation(double az, double ay, double ax)
      Set this frame's rotation according to the given angles.
      Parameters:
      az - Angle of rotation around the z axis.
      ay - Angle of rotation around the y axis.
      ax - Angle of rotation around the x axis.

    • setRotation

      public void setRotation(double[] axis, double angle)
      Set this frame's rotation according to the given axis and angle. Axis of rotation is assumed to be normalized.
      Parameters:
      axis - Axis of rotation.
      angle - Angle of rotation around the given axis.

    • setRotation

      public void setRotation(double[] axisAngle)
      Set this frame's rotation according to the given axis and angle. The norm of the axis is the size of the rotation angle.
      Parameters:
      axisAngle - The direction of this vector is the axis of rotation and its norm is the size of the rotation angle.

    • setRotation

      public void setRotation(double s, double x, double y, double z)
      Set this frame's rotation according to the given quaternion. Assumes that the quaternion is a unit quaternion, (s^2 + qx^2 + qy^2 + qz^2 = 1).
      Parameters:
      s - Scalar part of the quaternion.
      x - x coordinate of the quaternion.
      y - y coordinate of the quaternion.
      z - z coordinate of the quaternion.

    • set

      public void set(Frame f)
      Set this frame to the given frame.
      Parameters:
      f - Set the current frame to this frame.

    • getTranslation

      public void getTranslation(double[] translation)
      Get the translational part of this frame.
      Parameters:
      translation - An array into which the translation is written [x,y,z]. Has at least three entries.

    • getRotationAngles

      public void getRotationAngles(double[] angles)
      Get the angles of rotation from this frame. Rotation angles are for the ZYX Euler angle specification.
      Parameters:
      angles - An array into which the angles are written [ax,ay,az]. Has at least three entries.

    • getRotationAxisAngle

      public void getRotationAxisAngle(double[] axisAngle)
      Get the axis and angle of rotation from this frame.
      Parameters:
      axisAngle - An array into which the angle and the axis are written [a,nx,ny,nz]. Has at least four entries.

    • getRotationQuaternion

      public void getRotationQuaternion(double[] quaternion)
      Get the unit quaternion describing the rotation from this frame.
      Parameters:
      quaternion - An array into which the quaternion parameters are written [s,qx,qy,qz]. Has at least four entries.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      String represntation of a frame.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      Returns the String represnetation of this frame.
